thread.title: Daniel Craig won't say whether 'Spectre' is his 007 swansong
thread.title_full: Daniel Craig won't say whether 'Spectre' is his 007 swansong

title: Daniel Craig won't say whether 'Spectre' is his 007 swansong
text:
Updated: 11:50 a.m. Thursday, Oct. 22, 2015 | Posted: 11:49 a.m. Thursday, Oct. 22, 2015 Daniel Craig won't say whether 'Spectre' is his 007 swansong Sponsored Links 
Is "Spectre" Daniel Craig's Bond swansong? 
We'll have to wait and see. 
The British actor makes his fourth appearance as suave secret agent 007 in the Sam Mendes-directed film, which has its world premiere in London on Monday. 
Speculation has swirled that it will be Craig's last film as James Bond ever since the actor told Time Out magazine that he would only make another Bond movie "for the money." 
But Craig said Thursday that "I love making these films." 
Asked by Britain's Press Association about returning to Bond, Craig joked: "Do I have a choice?" 
Bond battles a shadowy international conspiracy in "Spectre," which stars Oscar winner Christoph Waltz as 007's nemesis. The film opens in the U.S. on Nov 6. Copyright The Associated Press Sign up for our WSOC-TV Daily Headlines Newsletter Sign Up
